articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Berwyn Powell)
articles.description: Websites, unfortunately, aren‚Äôt as environmentally friendly as we might like them to be. This article contains some thoughts and experiences from trying to clean them up.
articles.title: Reducing Carbon Emissions On The Web

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Louis Lazaris)
articles.description: Interactive coding tools to help you learn CSS, JavaScript, SQL, React, Vim, regular expressions and Jamstack.
articles.title: Interactive Learning Tools For Front-End Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Dirk Weber)
articles.description: What exactly is a displacement filter? In this article, Dirk Weber explains the SVG `feDisplacementMap` filter primitive with a good number of examples to demonstrate the concept of animated displacement maps.
articles.title: A Deep Dive Into The Wonderful World Of SVG Displacement Filtering

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (√Åtila Fassina)
articles.description: By combining some React APIs, we can accurately manage ‚Äúsimple‚Äù states. With Next.js though, we can quickly find situations where we need to accommodate many other requirements. Let‚Äôs have a look at some patterns to accomplish all that.
articles.title: State Management In Next.js

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: New month, new wallpapers! In this post, you‚Äôll find inspiring wallpaper designs for September 2021. They were created with love by artists and designers from across the globe and are available with and without a calendar. Enjoy!
articles.title: Stories Of September (2021 Desktop Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: There are many CSS optimization techniques to tackle potential file size and performance issues. Let‚Äôs take a look at some of them. After all, if deploying the refactored codebase causes loading or performance issues, it will result in less traffic and revenue, which might leave the management and project managers dissatisfied.
articles.title: Refactoring CSS: Optimizing Size And Performance (Part 3)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ichoku Chinonso)
articles.description: Compound components help developers build more expressive and flexible APIs to share state and logic within components. This tutorial explains how this can be achieved with the help of using the Context API and React to build components by using this advanced pattern.
articles.title: Compound Components In React

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Robin Berjon)
articles.description: The Web is still wrestling with issues we take for granted offline, privacy chief among them. These are steps The New York Times took to protect users‚Äô data, and how you can too.
articles.title: Pushing Back Against Privacy Infringement On The Web

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Leonardo Losoviz)
articles.description: In this article, Leonardo explains how to use a "multi-monorepo" approach for making the development experience faster, yet keeping your PHP packages private. This solution can be especially beneficial for PRO plugin creators.
articles.title: Creating A Public/Private Multi-Monorepo For PHP Projects

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Portia Burton)
articles.description: In this article, you‚Äôll learn how to save hours of tedious work of writing, updating, and correcting technical documentation. In this article, you will learn how to automate your documentation workflow with Vale and GitHub Actions.
articles.title: How To Automate Documentation Workflow For Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Robin Marx)
articles.description: After almost five years in development, the new HTTP/3 protocol is nearing its final form. Let‚Äôs take a close look at the performance improvements of HTTP/3, congestion control, head-of-line-blocking, and 0-RTT connection set-up.
articles.title: HTTP/3: Performance Improvements (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Mike Neumegen)
articles.description: The story of Jamstack CMSs goes all the way back to the 90s. In this article, we take a trip down memory lane to see how we got to the modern Jamstack CMSs we have today, and where they‚Äôre heading in the next decade.
articles.title: Jamstack CMS: The Past, The Present and The Future

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Devin Harold)
articles.description: Through a simple step-by-step approach, you can build an ethical practice within your organization that will ensure you‚Äôre respecting the dignity and welfare of your research participants.
articles.title: How To Build An Ethical User Research Practice At Any Organization

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Anna Prenzel)
articles.description: In this article, we will code a Gantt chart as a reusable Web component. We will focus on the architecture of the component, rendering the calendar with CSS Grid and managing the state of the draggable tasks with JavaScript Proxy Objects.
articles.title: Creating An Interactive Gantt Chart Component With Vanilla JavaScript

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Your project is on a tight budget? We‚Äôve collected some wonderful, free icons and goodies that we‚Äôve discovered lately and that are bound to give your design the finishing touch. We‚Äôve also just recently covered [Figma plugins](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2021/08/figma-tools-plugins-resources/), [SVG generators](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2021/03/svg-generators/), [accessible front-end components](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2021/03/complete-guide-accessible-front-end-components/) and [front-end boilerplates](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2021/06/useful-frontend-boilerplates-starter-kits/) ‚Äî you might find them useful, too.
articles.title: Free Open-Source Icons

articles.description:
I've written a fair bit about how using pull requests can encourage a
      low integration frequency, increasing cycle time and discouraging
      refactoring. Rouan Wilsenach has had success using an approach that categorizes
      changes as Ship/Show/Ask - using this classification to decide whether and
      how to use pull requests.
more‚Ä¶
articles.title: Ship / Show / Ask: A modern branching strategy

articles.description:

      indicate in that article that I am, but I felt it may be worth saying a
      bit more about what I‚Äôm concentrating on these days.
